Posts.Content: becky1 wrote: I posted in IDC but since I was told I'm atleast stage 3A or more, figured I'd try here. I am currently being treated with pre-surgery chemo to shrink 8cm tumor that ulcerated the skin. I'm constantly inflammed and on and off antibiotics to control that. I'm finishing up A/C chemo tomorrow and onco. wants me to do the Taxol routine after. My surgeon feels comfortable doing masectomy now but will make final decision after PET on Mon. yet onco disagrees and wants to continue to shrink it with the Taxol and feels continuing this treatment will better ensure no recurrence and long term survival, the surgeon disagrees. Shouldn't they agree and stop confusing me, who knows nothing about what the best route to take is? Isn't it better to get the cancer out? The decision in the end is mine to make, I know that and will wait until PET results, but was hoping for some advice. Continue with Taxol, then surgery, yet fear the cancer will spread regardless of treatment or Surgery then radiation? Onco keeps saying once you stop theres no going back? Please help me to understand. Dx 11/21/2009, IDC, 6cm+, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: need advice becky1 jenn3

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2010 02:23AM becky1 wrote: I was told that the tumor is liquifying..so yes it responded as far as I know to the a/c. I will have my first PET on the 15th and a follow up ct scan, i guess that will let me know how much of a response. I've been battling an "infection" on my breast(from the cancer) since Oct. and throughout my body for a long while that presents it self through my skin. I will weigh all my options but I don't want the anxiety of wanting the cancer OUT to cloud my better judgement if that is to proceed with the Taxol.
Posts.Title: need advice becky1 jenn3

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2010 10:25PM becky1 wrote: Thanks so much to all responses. So much relief knowing there is a name for this and that I'm not alone. My surgeon seemed at a loss to what it is, so now I can be armed with knowledge when I see him and oncologist next week. Thanks so much again!
Posts.Title: rope like tendon? becky1 jeanwash

Posts.Content: becky1 wrote: I did 4 rounds of AC (neo-chemo)and was suppose to start weekly Taxol yesterday, but..            Recent PET showed that though AC did shrink breast tumor from 5 to 3 ((so grateful for that))  2 nodes under the arm has actually grown some?? Now the chemo I will get is Taxotere. Is it common for the nodes NOT to respond to one type of chemo but respond to another, or do i have to keep worrying of further spread? I start the chemo tomorrow, had to start steroids today, but wont see DR. I will ask my nurse administering my IV what she thinks or knows.                                                                     Just would like to know how common this is. PET also showed spot on lung and liver, but am told not to worry since there has been no change either way in 3 months. Dont know about that either!!! Was trying to stay hopeful throughout this, got over the initial terrified part only to now have this news thrown at me. Trying not to get terrified again. Dx 11/21/2009, IDC, 6cm+, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: AC did not work on lymph node becky1 elena58

Posts.Content: becky1 wrote: Hello..hoping someone can give me some insight as to what may be happening. Will call Dr. on Monday but for now thought this mat help. I completed 4 rounds (every 3 weeks) of A/C then did two (every 3 weeks) rounds of taxotere which was extremely hard on me so dr. stopped it and will schedule my masectomy within the 2 weeks. As of last pet scan tumor responded but lymph nodes did not. Anyway since stopping taxotere 3 weeks ago my abdomen has continued to swell. It feels like jello and is starting to go around my sides to my back. My left leg continues to swell as well. Do you know what could be causing the fluid buidup? I have no pressure in chest(lungs) or any real pain so I'm guessing I'll be all right til I see doc. But any info. on what causes the buildup and what I should do will be appreciated. Thanks  Dx 11/21/2009, IDC, 6cm+, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: ascites becky1 katie11

Posts.Content: becky1 wrote: Hi, hope someone has an answer for me or can help. Had 9 nodes removed under arm a month ago and had to leave 2 drains in for two of those weeks. First under the arm am told there is a hematoma  which is causing a huge, hard and painful double roll, can not put arm all the way down. Second, what i really need an answer to, is there is a long hard cord/rope like thing that extends from chest, under arm and then down inside of arm. The surgeon said he was not sure what it was, possibly a spasm of some sort, maybe a tendon associated with lymphedema, yet I have no swelling but weakness (arm shakes when holding coffee cup and so on). Can not lift my arm past shoulder height because it pulls clear into chest and then protrudes and can visibly be seen and feels as hard as a rock. Does anyone know what this is or have had this? Thanks so much! Dx 11/21/2009, IDC, 6cm+, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: rope like tendon? becky1 jeanwash
